question:
What does this code segment print?
static void increment(int index) {
 index++;
}

public static void main(String[] args){
 int i = 0;
 increment(i);
 i++;
 System.out.println(i);
}
What class can use a method from another class without a visibility modifier?
correct_answer: Any class from the same package
incorrect_answers: Any class that extends this class
Any class from any subpackage of this package

question: What is an unchecked exception?
correct_answer: An exception that extends RuntimeException of Error that you do not need to catch or rethrow
incorrect_answers: An exception that extends RuntimeException that you may catch but cannot rethrow
An exception that can be of any type, and that you do not need to catch or rethrow
An exception that extends RuntimeException that you cannot catch but can rethrow

question: How can you add a method to an existing interface without having to modify the classes that already implement it?
correct_answer: You make this method a default method
incorrect_answers: You provide an implementation of this method in a separate static class
You make this method an abstract class
You cannot add a method to an interface without implementing in the existing implementing classes

question: What does a class need to do when it declares that it is implementing an interface?
correct_answer: It must be declared as abstract OR implement each of the interface's abstract methods, apart from the methods of the Object class.
incorrect_answers: It must implement each of the interface's abstract methods and override the default methods
It must be declared as abstract
It must implement each of the interface's abstract methods

question:
What will be the output of the following program?

public class MyFirst {

   public static void main(String[] args) {

      MyFirst obj =newMyFirst(n);

   }


   static int a = 10;

   static int n;

   int b = 5;

   int c;


   public MyFirst(int m) {

     System.out.println(a + ", " + b + ", " + c + ", " + n + ", "+m);

   }


   // Instance Block

   {

      b= 30;

      n = 20;

   }

   // Static Block

   static {

      a = 60;

   }

}
Which of the following option leads to the portability and security of Java?
correct_answer: Bytecode is executed by JVM
incorrect_answers: The applet makes the Java code secure and portable

question: What is the return type of the hashCode() method in the Object class?
correct_answer: int

question: What does the expression float a = 35 / 0 return?
correct_answer: Infinity

question:
Evaluate the following Java expression, if x=3, y=5, and z=10:
++z + y - y + z + x++

What will be the output of the following program?

public class Test {  

public static void main(String[] args) {  

    int count = 1;  

    while (count <= 15) {  

    System.out.println(count % 2 == 1 ?"***": "+++++");  

    ++count;  

        }

    }

 }
correct_answer: 8 times *** and 7 times +++++

question: Which of the following for loop declaration is not valid?
correct_answer: for ( int i = 99; i >= 0; i / 9 )
incorrect_answers: for ( int i = 2; i <= 20; i = 2* i )

question: Which of the following is true about the anonymous inner class?
correct_answer: It has no class name
incorrect_answers: It has a fixed class name

question: Which option is false about the final keyword?
correct_answer: A final class cannot extend other classes.
incorrect_answers: A final method cannot be overridden in its subclasses.
A final class cannot be extended.
A final method can be inherited.

question:
Given that Student is a class, how many reference variables and objects are created by the following code?

Student studentName, studentId;

studentName = new Student();

Student stud_class = new Student();
correct_answer: Three reference variables and two objects are created.
incorrect_answers: Two reference variables and two objects are created.
One reference variable and two objects are created.
Three reference variables and three objects are created.

question: Which of the following is a valid syntax to synchronize the HashMap?
correct_answer: Map m1 = Collections.synchronizedMap(hashMap);

question:
Given that strings is an ArrayList with the following elements: "one", "two" and "three", what does the following code do?

for (string s : strings){

    System.out.println("s = " + s);

    strings.remove("two");

}
correct_answer: The code throws a ConcurrentModificationException

question:
You have the following code

try (Reader reader1 = new FileReader("log.txt");

  Reader reader2 = new FileReader("log.txt")){

  // some code

} catch (IOException e){

}

At run time, the constructor of reader2 throws an IOException, and the close() method of reader1 also throws an IOException. What exception(s) is/are caught in this code ?
correct_answer: The exception thrown by the construction of reader2
incorrect_answers: The exception thrown by the closing of reader1
A third exception is caught, wrapping the two first exceptions

question: You need to concatenate a list of instances of String together. What precautions should you take ?
correct_answer: Avoid the unnecessary creation of instances of String
incorrect_answers: Properly flush the buffer of string in the returned String
Properly flush the buffer of strings
Make sure all the elements of the list are properly consumed

question: You need to distribute your application as a JAR file on the internet. How can you make your customer sure that the JAR they will download has not been modified by anyone?
correct_answer: You can sign it so that the JVM can check for its integrity
incorrect_answers: You can distribute a password along with it
You can distribute a hash code along with it
You can hash each class in it

question:
What will be the output of the following program?

public class MyFirst {

    public static void main(String[] args) {

        System.out.println("main");

        MyFirst obj = new MyFirst(n);

    }

   public MyFirst(int m) {

        System.out.println("constructor");

   }

    {

       System.out.println("instance");

    }

    static {

       System.out.println("static");

    }

}
correct_answer: static -> main -> instance -> constructor

question:
The following code is a part of a Java program 

String a = "Hello";

String b = " World";

a.concat(b);

How many instances of String are created at the end of the program?

You need to call a method that throws IOException and FileNotFoundException. Knowing that FileNotFoundException is an extension of IOException, among the following catch clauses, which one is NOT correct?
correct_answer: catch(FileNotFoundException e){}catch(IOException e){}

question:
The maximum value you can store in an int is 2147483647. What does the following code print out?

public static void main(String[] args){

  int max = 2147483647;

 System.out.println(max+1);

}
Which functional interface does not return a value?
correct_answer: Consumer

question: Why are Java streams considered lazy?
correct_answer: Because intermediate operations are not evaluated until the terminal operation is invoked
incorrect_answers: Because, when the terminal operation is called, traversal of streams begins and the associated function is performed one by one
Because intermediate operations are evaluated before the terminal operation is invoked
Because, when the intermediate operation is called, traversal of streams begins and the associated function is performed one by one

question: You have a stream of strings of characters. You want to concatenate all those strings using a comma as a separator. How do you proceed?
correct_answer: Collect the elements using the Collectors.joining() collector, passing the comma as a parameter.
incorrect_answers: Collect the elements in a StringJoiner and call join() on that object, passing the comma as a parameter.
Reduce the stream in a StringBuilder, using the StringBuilder::add as the reduction function.
Collect the elements in a list and call join() on that list, passing the comma as a parameter.

question: What does it mean for a field to be final?
correct_answer: Its value must be set during the construction of the object and cannot be modified.
incorrect_answers: The field cannot be overridden in any extension this class may have.
Once set, its value can only be modified within the instance initializer block.
The field is a constant, accessible from all the class instances.

question:
Given the following code: 

public static void main(String[] args) {

  int myInt = 2;

  float myFloat = 3.8f;

  double myDouble = 2.9;

  char myChar = 'P';

}

Which is a valid assignment operation?
correct_answer: myInt = myChar;

question:
What will happen when you write the following code? 

class Animal {

    //variables, constructors and methods

}

public class MainClass {

    public static void main(String[] args) {

        Animal animal;

        System.out.println(animal);

    }

}
correct_answer: A syntax error stating that the animal variable must be instantiated
incorrect_answers: "null" will be printed to the console.
"animal" will be printed to the console.
A NullPointerException when you run the application

question: You have a class Person with an age property of type int and its corresponding getter getAge(). You have a stream of instances of this class and want to divide this stream into two lists: the first containing the people younger than or equal to 20, and the other the people older than 20. Which collector can you use?
correct_answer: Collectors.partitioningBy(p -> p.getAge() > 20, toList())

question: You must create a size() method in an interface and provide an implementation. How do you declare this method?
correct_answer: default int size() { /* method implementation */ }

question: What do you need to make an interface a functional interface?
correct_answer: Make sure it has only one abstract method that needs to be implemented.

question: You have a User class with a single field: name. In your application, two instances of User are the same if they have the same name. Keeping in mind the optimized program performance and efficient object comparison, how can you enforce such a rule?
correct_answer: By overriding the equals(Object) and hashCode() methods in the User class
incorrect_answers: By creating an equals(User) and overriding the hashCode() method in the User class
By only creating an equals(User) method in the User class
By only overriding an equals(Object) method in the User class

question: How can a final field be set to a value?
correct_answer: By using an initializer or by setting it in a constructor
incorrect_answers: By setting it in a constructor only
By using an initializer and by optionally modifying this value in a constructor

question: What is true of a Stream?
correct_answer: Streams don't store their elements.
incorrect_answers: Streams support indexed access to their elements.

question: You have a Map<Integer, String>. This Map does not allow null values. You call the get() method with a key that is not present in it. What does this method return?
correct_answer: null

question: You want to package an application composed of many class files in a single Java Archive (JAR) and make it executable. How will you proceed?
correct_answer: Create a single JAR file containing a MANIFEST.mf file with a reference to the class that contains the main() method.
incorrect_answers: Create a single JAR file containing a MANIFEST.mf file with a reference to all the classes of that JAR.
Create one JAR file per module, put a MANIFEST.mf with a reference to the class that contains the main() method in one of them, and launch that JAR.
Package each module in a JAR, then package them in a meta-JAR, put a reference to the class that contains the main() method in this meta-JAR, and launch that JAR.

question: You wrote a method that takes an index (of type int) in a list as a parameter. Which properly documents this parameter in the Javadoc?
correct_answer: @param index the index in the list
incorrect_answers: @param int index the index in the list
@parameter int index the index in the list
@parameter index the index in the list

question: You want to add the content of an optional to a list. How do you proceed?
correct_answer: Call the following on the optional object: ifPresent(list::add)
incorrect_answers: Call the following on the optional object: orElse(list::add)
Call the following on the optional object: list.Add()
Call the following on the optional object: isPresent(list::add)

question: You must create a collection of strings. You want to guarantee that the iteration over this collection will be in the lexicographic order of the strings. What class will you use?
correct_answer: A TreeSet

question: You must sort a stream of strings of characters from the shortest string to the longest. How do you proceed?
correct_answer: Sort the stream by passing the comparator of strings that compares the length of the strings.
incorrect_answers: Collect the stream in a SortedSet built with the right comparator.
Map the strings to their length, then sort the result.
Collect the stream in a TreeMap where the keys are the length of the strings, then extract the ordered values.

question:
Given the following abstract class:

public abstract class AbstractTesting {

    public abstract int size();

    }

    public AbstractTesting() { 

    }

    abstract int getSize() {

        return size;

    }

}

Which part of this class will result in a syntax error?
correct_answer: The getSize() method

question:
You have the following code:

WorkOrder wo = new WorkOrder() {

    modelNumber = "LIF-42"

};

For this code to successfully compile, what must WorkOrder contain?
correct_answer: A default constructor and an editable String property modelNumber
incorrect_answers: A constructor that takes a String parameter, and a String attribute which will set a modelNumber

A constructor that takes a String parameter, which sets a modelNumber

question: How does a TreeMap store its key-value pairs?
correct_answer: It uses a red black tree
incorrect_answers: It puts the keys in an array with pointers to the values
It uses a skip list of key value pairs
It uses a set of Map.Entry objects

question: You need a class to handle sequences of characters. In your application, you must put these sequences in upper case and lower case and compare them between themselves. What class can you use?
correct_answer: The String class

question:
What does this code print out?

int[] tab = {1, 2, 3, 4};

int loop = 0;

for (int i : tab) {

  loop++;

  if (i > 2)

    break;

  loop++;

}

System.out.println("loop = " + loop);
correct_answer: loop = 5

question:
You have the following functional interface:

@FunctionalInterface

interface DoSomeMath {

}

What change to this interface will cause an error?
correct_answer:
Adding the following:

int subtract(int a, int b);
incorrect_answers:
Adding the following:

public static final int myInt = 0;

question:
Why doesn't the following code compile?

int i1 = 40_000;

short i2 = i1 + 10;
correct_answer: Because the addition returns an int, which cannot be converted to a short without an explicit cast
incorrect_answers: Because the addition returns a long, which cannot be cast to a short
Because 40_000 is not a valid number in Java
Because it is not possible to have a short greater than 32,767

question:
You have the two following classes:

public class Queue {

  public static final int MAX_SIZE = 10;

}

public class Consumer {

  static final int MAX_QUEUE_SIZE = Queue.MAX_SIZE;

}

These two classes happen to be in two different modules of your application. On day one, you compile both modules and deploy them in production. On day two, you modify the Queue class, by setting the MAX_SIZE value to 20. You compile the Queue module and deploy it in production. What happens when you launch your application?
correct_answer: The value of Consumer.MAX_QUEUE_SIZE is still 10.
incorrect_answers: The value of Consumer.MAX_QUEUE_SIZE is set to 20.
A RuntimeException is raised when you try to read the MAX_QUEUE_SIZE value.
A RuntimeException is raised when the application is launched.

question:
You are using the reduce() method to calculate the combined age of people in a group. You have the following code which tries to do that:

//assume implementation of a Person class that has a constructor for name

//and age, along with appropriate set and get methods

List people = Arrays.asList(new Person("Person 1", 20), new Person("Person 2", 25));

int result = people.stream().reduce(0, (currAge, user) -> currAge + user.getAge());

System.out.println(result);

This results in a syntax error. How can you change this to make it print out 45?
correct_answer:
Use a combiner
int result = people.stream().reduce(0, (currAge, user) -> currAge + user.getAge(), Integer::sum);
incorrect_answers:
Change the type of "result" from an int to a double
double result = people.stream().reduce(0, (currAge, user) -> currAge + user.getAge());

Change the type of "result" from an int to a float
float result = people.stream().reduce(0, (currAge, user) -> currAge + user.getAge());

Remove the first argument in the reduce() method
int result = people.stream().reduce((currAge, user) -> currAge + user.getAge());

question: What action would work when writing a method reference?
correct_answer: Calling of an instance method through the name of a class; for example: containingObject::instanceMethodName
incorrect_answers:
Calling a static method through an instance variable; for example:
instancevariable::staticMethodName

question: Which of Java's five functional interfaces operates on two reference types?
correct_answer: BinaryOperator

question: Which type of variable is created in a class, but located outside of all methods and constructors, and is visible to all methods and constructors of that class?
correct_answer: An instance variable

question:
You have two classes:

public class Holder {

  public String toString() {

    return "I am a holder";

  }

}

public class ExtendedHolder extends Holder {

  public String toString() {

     return "I am an extended holder";

  }

}

What does the following code print out when executed?

public class Main {

  public static void display(Holder holder) {

    Object o = holder;

    System.out.println(o.toString());

  }

  public static void main(String[] args) {

    Holder holder = new ExtendedHolder();

    display(holder);

  }

}
correct_answer: I am an extended holder
incorrect_answers:
I am an extended holder

I am a holder

java.lang.Object@4e04a765 (the number may vary)

question: How can you create a stream from the elements of a List variable called list?
correct_answer: By calling list.stream()

question:
You create a string of characters and then you trim it. Next, you put it in upper case and finally extract the first three characters using the substring method.

How many instances of the string would be created after the entire process of string operations?
You must create a new stream of names, but you do not yet have any elements to put in. How can you do this?
correct_answer: Stream names = Stream.empty();

question: What command must you use to execute a Main class that contains a main() method?
correct_answer: java Main

question: What is a lambda expression in Java?
correct_answer: An implementation of any functional interface
incorrect_answers: An implementation of an interface that must be defined in the java.util.function package

question: Using which type within a switch statement's test expression would result in a syntax error?
correct_answer: boolean

question:
What does the following code print out?

int i = 2;

int result = -1;

switch(i) {

  case 1: result = 1;

    break;

  case 2: result = 2;

  case 3: result = 3;

  case 4: result = 4;

}

System.out.println("result = " + result);
correct_answer: result = 4

question:
Consider the following code:

ArrayList arrayListObject = new ArrayList<>();

arrayListObject.add("B");

arrayListObject.add("D");

arrayListObject.add("A");

arrayListObject.add("C");

How can you sort the list of these letters in alphabetical order?
correct_answer:
arrayListObject = (ArrayList) arrayListObject

  .stream()

  .sorted()

  .collect(Collectors.toList());

question:

public class Holder {

  static String MAX_SIZE = System.getProperty("max.size");

}

You execute the following code:

Holder holder1 = new Holder();

Holder holder2 = new Holder();

How many times is the getProperty("max.size") method called?
incorrect_answers: 0 because this code will get an exception
0 because this property never gets initialized

question: How can you declare that a class ArrayList can use the methods of the AbstractList class, is of type Serializable, and provides implementations for the methods of List?
correct_answer: class ArrayList extends AbstractList implements List, Serializable
incorrect_answers: class ArrayList implements List, Serializable extends AbstractList
class ArrayList extends AbstractList implements List as Serializable
